title: Everyone knows
content: Everyone knows that debugging is twice as hard as writing a program in the first place. So if you're as clever as you can be when you write it, how will you ever debug it?
author: Brian Kernighan

title: Best programming
content: Some of the best programming is done on paper, really. Putting it into the computer is just a minor detail.
author: Max Kanat-Alexander

title: Create Things
content: When you don't create things, you become defined by your tastes rather than ability. Your tastes only narrow & exclude people. So create.
author: Why The Lucky Stiff

title: Not Great
content: I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.
author: Kent Beck

title: Walking on water
content: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

title: Disastrous
content: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
author: Alan Kay

title: Important
content: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

title: Good Software
content: Delivering good software today is often better than perfect software tomorrow, so finish things and ship.
author: David Thomas

title: Optimize
content: If you optimize everything, you will always be unhappy.
author: Donald Knuth

title: Bug?
content: It's not a bug; it's an undocumented feature.
author: Lernantino
